p: 8 dogs met the inclusion criteria and underwent CDF using an intervertebral traction device (Fits Intervertebral Traction Screw; FITS) with positive threaded pins and polymethylmethacrylate bone cement. Data collected from electronic patient records included patient signalment, duration of clinical signs, findings on neurologic examination, MRI findings, implants utilised and clinical outcome. Long‐term outcome was assessed via telephone interview (5.5‐ 45months). A distraction index was calculated to assess for evidence of vertebral subsidence comparing immediate post‐op and long‐term post‐op imaging. A paired sample t‐test was used to assess for significance.
